1.text: Remove the mushrooms from the ground as soon as you see the caps appear.

3.text: Apply a nitrogen fertilizer to deter mushrooms from growing in organic matter.

4.text: Use soap and water to kill off the mushrooms.

6.text: Make sure that your lawn has proper drainage.

7.text: Make sure that your lawn has well-drained soil.

8.text: Trim down tree branches to minimize shade.

9.text: De-thatch the lawn to minimize shade and create more air circulation.

10.text: Make sure that there is enough air circulation by aerating your lawn.

11.text: Eliminate decaying elements that enhance the growth of mushrooms.

13.text: Determine how deep the fairy ring goes.

14.text: Use a lawn aerator on fairy rings if the fungal mat is fewer than 3 inches (7.62 centimeters) thick.

15.text: Dig out fairy rings if the fungus mat is deeper than 3 inches (7.62 centimeters).

16.text: Discard the mushrooms and contaminated soil.

17.text: Fill the plugs in with fresh soil.

18.text: Consider patching up the soil with a quick-growing grass.
